intro: Dipterosiphon, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky bracts that resemble the appearance of holly leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salty, sandy soils. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in the spring. Dipterosiphon is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
